subject: Leadership
title: Lee Kuan Yew and Nation Building
description: A fast breakdown of Lee Kuan Yew and Nation Building for builders.

hook.text: Singapore: a tiny island with no resources. In one generation, it became one of the world's wealthiest nations.

buildup.text: Lee Kuan Yew ruled with pragmatism: meritocracy, anti-corruption enforcement, and strategic investment in education.

discovery.text: He prioritized results over ideology. Left or right didn't matter. What worked mattered. Pragmatism at its peak.

twist.text: His authoritarianism drew criticism: limited press freedom and political opposition. Results came at a democratic cost.

climax.text: Singapore asks: can good outcomes justify restricted freedoms? Leaders must weigh results against rights honestly.

punchline.text: He built a nation. The debate is whether the price was right.

quiz.question: What tension does Lee Kuan Yew's leadership illustrate?
options: Economic growth is easy to achieve
Results-oriented leadership can come at the cost of democratic freedoms
